sub_title: Lecturer | PhD Researcher | Social Development Worker
summary:
A researcher with strong academic background in development studies, poverty and policy analysis, as well as social policy and social protection, along with relevant experience in carrying out research in both developing-country and international contexts. A social development practitioner with more than ten years of experience working in/with non-government organisations and grassroots communities, and taking on roles related to research, publication, advocacy, alliance and network coordination, project development and management, resource mobilisation, and donor relations.

A wife of a talented visual artist and a mother of two boys. Believes she has a good singing voice and will gladly belt out her favourite songs at the karaoke. Bakes her own bread, especially now while in quarantine. Is passionate about women's rights and social justice, and tries to contribute to relevant advocacies in any way she can, i.e., donating, joining campaigns and mobilisations, and volunteering.

treasury_media.title: COVID-19 | Ephemeral universalism in the social protection response to the COVID-19 lockdown in the Philippines |
treasury_media.description: A piece I co-wrote with my PhD supervisors for our institute's blog (BLISS). #Philippines #socialprotection #spresponses #COVID19

treasury_media.title: Reconsidering the Philippines Pantawid as a Best Practice in Cash Transfers
treasury_media.description: My presentation at the 2018 UNRISD international conference. Here, I argued that donor-endorsed 'best practice' in poverty-targeted social protection has failed to provide safety net & undermined the country's broader social provisioning system.

school.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

education.field_of_study: Development Studies, major in Poverty Studies and Policy Analysis

awards.title: Distinction
awards.description: Distinction for the research paper, 'The Politics of Conditional Cash Transfers of the Philippines'

awards.title: Excellence Award
awards.description: Recognition for outstanding academic performance in all courses related to mass communication/media
awards.issuer: Kapisanan ng mga Brodkaster ng Pilipinas (Association of Philippine Broadcasters)

awards.title: Special Citation
awards.description: Special citation for the student-research, 'A Video-Documentary on the Plight of Newsboys in Cebu City'

profile_positions.description: Teaching and facilitating tutorials, as well as coordinating and co-organising courses in the BA International Studies, Faculty of Humanities. Courses taught include Introduction to International Studies and Cultural Studies (1st year courses), Economy: South and Southeast Asia (2nd year course), and Practising International Studies (3rd year course).
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description: Doing a comparative case study of the political economy of social protection in Cambodia and the Philippines, with particular emphasis on the role of external donor influences in shaping the social protection systems  in these two countries
profile_positions.title: PHD Researcher

company.name: Kaabag sa Sugbo (tr. Partner of Cebu)

profile_positions.company: Kaabag sa Sugbo (tr. Partner of Cebu)
profile_positions.description:
Kaabag sa Sugbo is a coalition of around 30 social development organizations based in the province of Cebu.
• Led the implementation of the coalition's strategic plan, particularly in terms of membership expansion and support, external relations and partnerships, and resource mobilization
• Led the coalition's advocacy work 
• Led the coalition's resource mobilization effort, particularly in project proposal development
• Supervised the day-to-day office operations and project implementation
profile_positions.title: Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
FORGE is a social development organization that organizes and builds the capacities of informal settlers/urban poor communities to be able to fight for their rights and meaningfully participate in governance and policymaking. It also assists and rescues commercially sexually exploited children (CSEC).
• Lobbied with local government for the adoption and implementation of policies and legislations that protect the rights of informal settlers
• Represented FORGE and the NGO bloc in Cebu City's Local Housing Board, the policymaking body pertaining to socialized housing and other issues relevant to informal settlers
• Chaired the Local Housing Board's Beneficiary Selection Committee, which is responsible for the screening of socialized housing applicants
• Upon the appointment of the Local Housing Board, served as pro bono consultant to the Division for the Welfare of the Urban Poor, Cebu City's implementing arm for its socialized housing and other related programs
• Led FORGE's writers' pool whose main tasks were project proposal development and report preparation
profile_positions.title: Advocacy Officer, Urban

profile_positions.description:
• In research, monitored local and national developments, and government policies and budgets that impact FORGE's advocacies; produced policy briefs and other information materials for partner-communities; and led the conduct of Participatory Research and Action (PRA) in partner-barangays (villages), the results of which served as bases for the barangays' development planning, and, on FORGE's side, for action and advocacy
• In documentation, took charge of documenting and recording the proceedings of major organizational activities, such as planning, project assessments, and trainings
• In publication, was editor-in-chief of Barug (to make a stand), FORGE's quarterly newsletter aimed at informing and educating partner-communities on burning issues and on such themes as gender, good governance, human rights, reproductive health, and the social development goals
profile_positions.title: Research, Documentation, and Publication Officer
